page.title: 07FARMING IN HENLLAN (3)
page.content: Sheep are fattened and provide wool. The main breeds kept are Suffolks or cross bred Welsh Mountain,Leicester or Dorset.There has been a trend to produce leaner lambs due to a change in public demand. Some wintering of sheep brought down from the Denbigh Moors still takes place. Fat sheep are either sold in local markets at Denbigh,Ruthin and St.Asaph or to the Welsh Quality Lamb abbatoir at Henllan.Wool is also sold locally to the Wool Producers of Wales sorting and grading depot at Denbigh. Membership of the EEC.has led to a gradual change in farming with better financial support from CAP.for sheep output leading to an increase in their numbers whilst milk quotas have led to a decline in milk production.
